Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Deacon Pedro O'Brien, Lady of Lourdes Church located at 463 West142nd Street, New York, NY 10031.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member De La Rosa.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Deacon Pedro O'Brien, Lady of Lourdes Church located at 463 West 142nd Street, New York, N.Y. 10031.

Council Member De La Rosa moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 12, 2025 be adopted as printed by Council Member Avilés.
Items.MinutesNote: On behalf of Council Member Aviles, the Majority Leader (Council Member Farias) moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 12, 2025 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Items.AgendaNote: COMMUNICATIONS FROM CITY, COUNTY & BOROUGH OFFICES

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca)
Pursuant to Sections 11.20(b-d) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Application No. C 250288 PCK, C 250287 ZSK, and C 250286A ZSK (Herkimer-Williams) shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related to Application Nos. C 250285 ZMK and N 250284 ZRK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Herkimer-Williams, Brooklyn (C 250288 PCK, C 250287 ZSK, C 250286A ZSK, C 250285 ZMK and N 250284 ZRK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation to lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Lower the age of eligibility for Older Americans Act-supported social services and programs from 60 to 45 years for individuals living with HIV.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.3563/A.2367, to expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Expand eligibility for the Disability Rent Increase Exemption program to additional qualifying household members (S.3563/A.2367).

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass, and the President to sign, legislation that would expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Expand Medicare to include long-term services and supports for seniors and individuals with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass, A.7851, and the Governor to sign, S.2534/A.7851, which retroactively freezes the rent at which a SCRIE or DRIE enrollee pays at the level it was when they first became eligible, or at the level it was two years before they entered the program, given that entrance into the program occurred more than two years after they first became eligible.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Aging
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Retroactively freezes the rent at which a SCRIE or DRIE enrollee pays at the level it was when they first became eligible, or at the level it was two years before they entered the program (S.2534/ A.7851)

Items.Title: Resolution declaring New York City’s commitment to affirm and defend continued access for reproductive rights
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted

.The following 8 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote in the negative against this item:  
Council Members Carr, Felder, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola)

.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Declaring New York City’s commitment to affirm and defend continued access for reproductive rights.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, December 4, 2025.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Orders Calendar and voted separately:

Preconsidered Res. No. 1153,  ***VOTE: 41-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

M-182 & Res. No. 1167,  ***VOTE: 39-1-8
Negative: Council Member Carr;
Abstentions: Council Members Brewer, Marte, Morano, Narcisse, Restler, Sanchez, Schulman, and Zhuang.

M-184 & Res. No. 1168, ***VOTE: 42-0-6
Abstentions: Council Members Brewer, Marte, Restler, Sanchez, Schulman, and Zhuang.

See files for individual votes.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
